Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DOCX Validation reporting 0 errors on invalid document" (#592) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
[x] Issue with the OpenXml library

**Description**

Invalid DOCX document that cannot be opened with Microsoft Word 2019 is reported as valid by Open XML SDK Validator.

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Framework 4.7.2
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.9.1

**Repro**

Create a new valid DOCX document containing table and remove <w:p /> child element from <w:tc> parent.

![wp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46950152/57427587-d2a61680-7224-11e9-8d01-7373706092c3.png)

Validation will report 0 errors, while Microsoft Word would report error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46950152/57427641-18fb7580-7225-11e9-898d-7387228f0ce4.png)

I'm attaching such corrupted document.
[word.docx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/3160367/word.docx)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Remove state from most semantic constraints" (#591) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened pull request "Remove state from most semantic constraints" (#591) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened pull request "Initial validation attribute support" (#590) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This change removes the need for some of the data files by moving the validation info to be expressed as attributes on properties/classes. This will be collected at runtime. This change is part of a few changes, and as such doesn't actually remove the files yet as they are needed for some mapping into another part of the validation system. A subsequent change will update that part of the validation system.
